responsive-considerations: ColumnLayout automatically adapts to mobile layouts with sidebar stacking
Grid automatically adapts to mobile layouts
Block components stack vertically on small screens
Button groups adjust spacing and alignment responsively
Tables may require horizontal scrolling on mobile
Modal and drawer components handle mobile constraints automatically
Most components maintain 44px minimum touch targets on mobile

setupAndGettingStarted.systemSetup: Always start with system-setup.json for installation and configuration guidance
setupAndGettingStarted.pageStructure: Use layout.json to understand ColumnLayout, PageBlock, and responsive behavior
setupAndGettingStarted.firstSteps: Begin with Button, Input, FormItem, and Container for basic functionality

componentSelection.forForms: Always use FormItem as wrapper, choose appropriate input types (Input, DatePicker, Dropdown, etc.), end with Button or ButtonGroup
componentSelection.forLayouts: Start with ColumnLayout for page structure, use Block for spacing, Container for visual grouping, Grid for multi-column layouts
componentSelection.forData: Use Table with Pagination for large datasets, Badge for status display, IconButton for row actions
componentSelection.forNavigation: Use Link for simple navigation, SideMenu for hierarchical content, Tabs for related content switching

spacingPrinciples.fundamental: Components manage spacing TO subsequent elements, not FROM previous elements
spacingPrinciples.pattern: Each component owns its relationship with what follows it
spacingPrinciples.example: GoabFormItem mb='l' creates space to next element, not GoabButton mt='l'
spacingPrinciples.antiPattern: Never use className='mb-8' or similar CSS classes - use component spacing props instead
spacingPrinciples.alternative: Use GoabSpacer component for explicit spacing between elements when component props aren't sufficient

accessibilityPriorities: Always provide labels through FormItem component
Use semantic heading levels with Text component
Ensure IconButton components have descriptive ariaLabel props
Test keyboard navigation through all interactive components
Verify screen reader compatibility with proper markup
performanceConsiderations: Use Pagination with large datasets to avoid performance issues
Consider virtualization for very long lists or tables
Lazy load Modal and Drawer content when possible
Optimize file upload sizes and provide progress feedback
Use appropriate image sizing in Grid layouts

textComponentRule.enforcement: GoabText provides built-in design system typography, optimal readability width, and consistent spacing

pageRoot.rule: MUST be the root component for any government service page

contentWrapper.rule: MUST wrap all main content within OneColumnLayout
contentWrapper.widthGuidance: 704px for forms/articles, 960px for wider content, full for dashboards

enforcePatterns: Never generate code with div/Container as page root
Always import OneColumnLayout and PageBlock together
Always use section elements with slot attributes

beforeGeneratingCode: 1. Verify ALL component properties against documented valid values
2. Check provided design specifications (JSON/Figma data) for exact sizing
3. Ensure no custom styling - only use component props
4. Validate spacing tokens match design system
5. Confirm color properties use only documented values
aiValidationChecklist.mandatoryValidation: AI MUST validate every property before code generation
aiValidationChecklist.errorHandling: Stop generation and request clarification for invalid properties

designSpecificationRule.priority: CRITICAL - Design specifications override AI assumptions
designSpecificationRule.rule: ALWAYS analyze provided Figma JSON data for exact component sizing, spacing, and hierarchy
designSpecificationRule.enforcement: Match visual hierarchy from design files, not generic best practices

examples.correct: If design shows heading-l, use size='heading-l' even if it seems like a main title
examples.incorrect: Assuming main titles should always be heading-xl

designDataAnalysis.rule: When user provides Figma JSON or design specifications, ALWAYS analyze for exact component configurations
required: Extract exact size values from design hierarchy
Identify spacing patterns from layout data
Match component configurations to design specs
Never override design specifications with generic assumptions
designDataAnalysis.designDataPriority: Design specifications ALWAYS override default component assumptions

universalConstraints.appliesTo: ALL GoA components across the entire design system
universalConstraints.severity: CRITICAL - These rules must NEVER be violated

noCustomStyling.rule: NEVER add custom styling to any GoA component or child elements
violations: ❌ inline styles on child elements like <a> inside <GoabLink>
correct: ✅ Use only documented component props: gap, direction, alignment, mb, mt
✅ Trust GoA components - they handle ALL styling automatically
noCustomStyling.enforcement: Components provide complete styling through documented properties only

validPropertiesOnly.rule: ONLY use properties explicitly documented in each component's API
validPropertiesOnly.process: Always verify property exists in component documentation before using
validPropertiesOnly.correct: ✅ Check component_consumer.json files for valid properties

designSystemIcons.rule: NEVER use emojis as icons - ALWAYS use component icon properties

headerToContent.rule: ALWAYS add mt='2xl' to first content element after any header
headerToContent.example: <GoabText tag='h1' mt='2xl' mb='l'>First content after header</GoabText>
headerToContent.enforcement: Creates proper visual separation from header components

useButton: Actions that trigger functionality (submit, save, cancel)
Navigation within application flow (back, continue, next step)
Any action that changes application state

buttonGroupVsBlock.useButtonGroup: For related action buttons with semantic relationship
buttonGroupVsBlock.useBlock: For general layout of mixed components

beforeGeneratingCode: 1. Check universalConstraints for rules that apply to ALL components
2. Verify all properties exist in component API documentation
3. Never add custom styling - trust component props
4. Use proper icon properties instead of emojis
5. Add mt='2xl' to first content after headers
whenInDoubt: Use GoA design system components as designed - don't override

noCustomStyling.rule: NEVER use style={}, className, or custom CSS on any GoA component
noCustomStyling.enforcement: Components provide ALL styling through documented props only
noCustomStyling.applies: Both the component itself AND child elements (like <a> inside <GoabLink>)

validPropertiesOnly.rule: ONLY use properties explicitly documented in component API
validPropertiesOnly.enforcement: Check component documentation before using any property

headerSpacing.rule: ALWAYS add mt='2xl' to first content element after headers
headerSpacing.applies: Any first content after GoabAppHeader, in GoabPageBlock, or after section headers

noEmojisAsIcons.rule: NEVER use emojis as icons - use leadingIcon/trailingIcon props
noEmojisAsIcons.enforcement: GoA Design System provides proper icon system

spacingDefaults.useMarginBottom: Always prefer mb over mt for consistent spacing flow
spacingDefaults.pageContentToFooter: ALWAYS use mb='3xl' on last page content element
spacingDefaults.formInputSpacing: Use mb='xl' between form inputs in a set
spacingDefaults.sectionHeadingToInput: Use mb='xl' between heading-l and first form input

inputSizingRules.analyzeDataType: Always consider expected input length before setting width
inputSizingRules.dropdownWidth: Never set width on dropdowns unless design specifies
inputSizingRules.textInputWidth: Must explicitly set width='100%' for variable length content
inputSizingRules.fixedWidthData: Use character lengths (ch) for predictable data like postal codes

requirementFieldRules.defaultStrategy: Don't mark required fields to reduce visual noise
requirementFieldRules.optionalOnly: Only use requirement='optional' when field is truly optional
requirementFieldRules.helpTextProhibition: NEVER use helpText for requirement status - only for additional guidance

actionElements.question: Is this an action that changes state or navigates within the app?
actionElements.ifYes: Use GoabButton with appropriate type (primary, secondary, tertiary)
actionElements.ifNo: Use GoabLink for external links, downloads, or reference links

buttonGrouping.question: Are these multiple related action buttons?
buttonGrouping.ifNo: Use GoabBlock for mixed component layouts

textStyling.question: Does the text need emphasis or different weight?
textStyling.answer: Use semantic tag (h1-h6) and size prop - weight property doesn't exist

enhancedVisualPatternMapping.description: Comprehensive mapping from Figma visual elements to GoA components with decision trees

visualCues: Gray banner at top with 'This is an official website'

textSizeDetection.rule: Compare text sizes in Figma design to determine GoabText size prop
textSizeDetection.serviceOverview: If paragraph text appears larger than surrounding text AND introduces the service, use size='body-l'
textSizeDetection.regularContent: Standard paragraph text uses default body-m sizing
textSizeDetection.headings: Map h1→heading-xl, h2→heading-l, h3→heading-m based on visual hierarchy

pageContentSpacing.topSpacing: Always mt='2xl' on first content element after header
pageContentSpacing.bottomSpacing: Always mb='3xl' on last content element before footer
pageContentSpacing.sectionSpacing: mt='2xl' between major sections, mt='xl' between subsections

footerPatterns.recognitionRule: Count link types and groupings to determine footer structure
footerPatterns.metaOnly: Single row of utility links → GoabAppFooterMetaSection only
footerPatterns.navPlusMeta: Multiple sections with headings → GoabAppFooterNavSection + GoabAppFooterMetaSection

actionPatterns.primaryCTA: Main action button → search button_consumer.json for appropriate type and icon patterns
actionPatterns.emailLinks: Contact email addresses → GoabLink wrapping mailto anchor

aiDecisionTree.step1: Identify page type (service landing, form, dashboard)
aiDecisionTree.step2: Map visual hierarchy to typography sizes using text_consumer.json patterns
aiDecisionTree.step3: Search appropriate component files for action patterns (button_consumer.json, link_consumer.json)
aiDecisionTree.step4: Apply standard spacing patterns from layout.json unless design shows otherwise
aiDecisionTree.step5: Choose footer variant based on link groupings using footer_consumer.json guidance

visualPatternMapping.description: Maps common visual elements to their corresponding GoA components - search these first

criticalPatterns.governmentNoticeBanner: MicrositeHeader - handles 'This is an official website of the Alberta Government'
criticalPatterns.serviceHeader: AppHeader - main service/page title and navigation
criticalPatterns.pageLayout: OneColumnLayout for overall structure - ALWAYS USE THIS AS PAGE WRAPPER
criticalPatterns.successConfirmation: Callout type='success' - for status messages and confirmations with built-in checkmark icon
criticalPatterns.successContentGroup: Container type='success' - for grouping approved/completed content items
criticalPatterns.statusMessages: Callout - always use for communicating results/status to users
criticalPatterns.contentOrganization: Container - use for grouping related content/form sections

mandatoryDefaults.pageStructure: ALWAYS start with GoabOneColumnLayout as the root component for any government service page
mandatoryDefaults.contentArea: ALWAYS wrap main content in GoabPageBlock with appropriate width (704px for forms, 960px for wider content, full for dashboards)
mandatoryDefaults.headerSlot: ALWAYS use section slot='header' containing MicrositeHeader and AppHeader
mandatoryDefaults.footerSlot: ALWAYS use section slot='footer' containing AppFooter

searchStrategy: 0. ALWAYS start with OneColumnLayout for page structure
2. Search for functional terms (e.g., 'government notice', 'form field')
3. Search for visual descriptors (e.g., 'gray banner', 'blue button')
4. Check layout and system components for structural elements

componentDecisionRules.rule: If the element communicates status/result → Callout
If the element groups related content → Container

beforeGeneratingCode: Identify if green element shows STATUS (→ Callout) or GROUPS CONTENT (→ Container)
Check for built-in icons in design (suggests Callout)
Look for prominent vs subtle styling differences
Consider semantic purpose over visual appearance alone

successElementChecklist.question: Does this element announce a result/status to the user?

ifYes.props: type='success', heading prop for title, size='large' for prominence

ifNo.props: type='success', title prop for header, accent='thick' for prominence
